intro: Bourreria apetala, commonly known as the Florida flame flower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, red-orange flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. It thrives in wet, sandy soils and is often found in swampy areas and along the edges of ponds. Its unique floral structure and vibrant color make it a notable species in wetland ecosystems.
